The '''[[2002 NFL season|2002]] [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] [[season (sports)|season]]''' began with the team trying to improve on a 9-7 season and did so with a franchise best 12-4 record. It was Jon Gruden's first season as the Buccaneers head coach. They won the [[Super Bowl XXXVII|Super Bowl]] for the first time in the team's history, beating the [[Oakland Raiders]] 48â21.
